meanings.definition: Involving mutual assistance or working together towards a common goal.
meanings.sent1: The students were very cooperative during the group project.
meanings.sent2: The ants showed cooperative behavior while building their nest.
meanings.sent3: The cooperative ducks took turns leading the way to the pond.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the clock were cooperative in keeping time together.
meanings.sent5: The firefighters worked in a cooperative manner to put out the fire.

meanings.definition: A business or organization owned and operated by its members for their mutual benefit.
meanings.sent1: The local cooperative sells fresh produce grown by its members.
meanings.sent2: She decided to join the cooperative to support local farmers.
meanings.sent3: The cooperative's annual meeting turned into a lively potluck party.
meanings.sent4: The cooperative acted like a big family, always looking out for each other.
meanings.sent5: Being part of the cooperative meant sharing both the work and the rewards.

meanings.definition: Willing to comply or work together with others.
meanings.sent1: The team was very cooperative in following the coach's instructions.
meanings.sent2: The dog was cooperative during obedience training.
meanings.sent3: The cooperative cat allowed the new kitten to play with its toys.
meanings.sent4: The plants in the garden were cooperative in sharing sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The children were cooperative in cleaning up the classroom after art class.
